page.title: 06Housing in Wootton
page.content: Wootton Parish has a population of 3000, largely housed on estates to the west of the main road. The old village stretching up to Boar's Hill is a line of {ribbon development}of very low density, the size of houses and grounds becoming most spacious on Boar's Hill. The village green is backed by a small line of modern houses, one of which has been extended to provide a granny flat. Across the green an old house,'The Butts', has been extended for the same purpose. Close beside the green are two very old thatched cottages, with a third a few doors away. Some of the estates were originally council houses but two thirds of these have now been bought from the council by the former tenants. Some council houses are retained for the use of RAF personnel based at Abingdon RAF station.
